com.anotherservice.db

Class PooledDatabase

  • Object
    • Database
      • PooledDatabase
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class PooledDatabase
extends Database
    This class is a generic Database (possibly blocking) pool. It creates new instances when required and cleans-up old instances when idle.
    Author:
    Simon Uyttendaele
    Note:
    New connections are created using the Database.clone() method and are stored as a stack.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class Database

        Database.Mode

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean blocking
      Determines if the pool should wait for a instance to be available or throw an exception otherwise.
      long blockTimeout
      The maximum number of milliseconds a thread can be waiting to obtain a connection.
      long checkInterval
      The checking interval in milliseconds that a blocked thread checks for an available connection.
      int maxActiveConnections
      Maximum number of connections in the pool.
      int minActiveConnections
      Minimum number of connections in the pool.

      • Fields inherited from class Database

        connection, database, host, password, port, testSelect, user

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PooledDatabase(Database template)
      Constructor with the template Database that should be cloned to populate the pool.

    • Field Detail

      • blocking

        public boolean blocking
        Determines if the pool should wait for a instance to be available or throw an exception otherwise.
        Default : true
        See Also:
        blockTimeout

      • maxActiveConnections

        public int maxActiveConnections
        Maximum number of connections in the pool.
        Default : 10

      • minActiveConnections

        public int minActiveConnections
        Minimum number of connections in the pool.
        Default : 1

      • blockTimeout

        public long blockTimeout
        The maximum number of milliseconds a thread can be waiting to obtain a connection. If the time is reached, an IllegalStateException is thrown. If the blockTimeout is 0 then the thread waits until a new connection is returned to the pool.
        Default : 0

      • checkInterval

        public long checkInterval
        The checking interval in milliseconds that a blocked thread checks for an available connection.
        Default : 50

    • Constructor Detail

      • PooledDatabase

        public PooledDatabase(Database template)
        Constructor with the template Database that should be cloned to populate the pool.
        Note:
        that the template instance will be closed.

    • Method Detail

      • query

        public Object query(String sql,
           Database.Mode mode)
             throws SQLException
        Overrides Database.query(String, Database.Mode) in order to query the next available connection in the pool.
        Overrides:
        query in class Database
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL request
        mode - The query type
        Returns:
        The query result
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the pool has been closed.
        IllegalStateException - if the individual connection gotten from the pool is no longer alive.
        NoSuchElementException - if a connection could not be retrieved within allowed time (timeout).
        SQLException

      • clone

        public Database clone()
        Cloning this instance is not allowed.
        Specified by:
        clone in class Database
        Returns:
        null

      • close

        public void close()
           throws SQLException
        Overrides Database.close() in order to close all instances in the pool.
        Active connections that are not back in the pool yet will be closed upon return.
        Overrides:
        close in class Database
        Throws:
        SQLException
        Note:
        Closing the pool cannot be reverted.

      • connect

        protected void connect()
                throws SQLException
        Description copied from class: Database
        This method should be implemented in order to (re)establish the connection. This method will be called when a dropped connection is discovered in order to reconnect to the database. (SQLState 08*)
        Specified by:
        connect in class Database
        Throws:
        SQLException
